citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of Desulfitobacterium frappieri sp. nov., an anaerobic bacterium which reductively dechlorinates pentachlorophenol to 3-chlorophenol.

p.s: Description of Desulfitobacterium frappieri sp. nov.
Desulfitobacterium frappieri (frap.pi.e'ri M. L. gen. n. frappieri, of Frappier, in honor of Armand Frappier, a renowned Canadian microbiologist)
Strain PCP-1 is the type strain of Desulfitobacterium frappieri.
This strain has been deposited in the American Type Culture Collection.
The kinetics of dechlorination of PCP to 3-CP is shown in Fig. 5.
PCP was dechlorinated to 3,4,5-trichlorophenol in less than 12 h.
A lag of 36 h occurred before 3,4,5-trichlorophenol began to be dechlorinated to 3,5-dichlorophenol and 3-CP.
A trace amount of 3,4-dichlorophenol was also found, and this trace probably originated from 2,3,4,6-tetrachlorophenol, a known contaminant of PCP preparations.
We examined the dechlorination of all possible chlorophenols by strain PCP-1T (Table 2).
Dechlorinations in ortho, meta, and para positions were observed.
The following chlorophenols were not dehalogenated: 2-chlorophenol, 3-CP, 4-chlorophenol, 2,5-dichlorophenol, and 3,bdichlorophenol.
No dehalogenation of these mono- and dichlorophenols was observed even when PCP was added to the culture medium as a possible inducer.
